title: Domain 4.9: Given a scenario, use data sources to support an investigation.
content:
🔥 Firewall Logs

Show incoming and outgoing traffic—useful for detecting unauthorized access or unusual patterns.

📝 Application Logs

Record events from applications—help trace errors, crashes, and suspicious activity within the app.

📱 Endpoint Logs

Provide information from user devices—tracks activities like logins, file access, or malware activity.

💻 OS-Specific Security Logs

Logs generated by the operating system—important for identifying system-level security incidents.

🛡️ IPS/IDS Logs

Logs from Intrusion Prevention or Detection Systems—alert on suspicious traffic or known attack signatures.

🌐 Network Logs

Capture data about network traffic—important for spotting DDoS attacks, unauthorized access attempts, or lateral movement.

🗂️ Metadata

Data about data (e.g., file timestamps, IPs, file size)—useful for tracking file movements or unauthorized access.

📊 Data Sources

🕵️ Vulnerability Scans

Automated scans that identify weaknesses in systems, applications, or networks—help prioritize patching or remediation.

📑 Automated Reports

Pre-scheduled reports that give insights into system health, vulnerabilities, or incident trends.

📉 Dashboards

Visual representations of security metrics—help analysts monitor security posture and detect anomalies.

📡 Packet Captures

Detailed data of network traffic—helps in deep packet analysis to identify malicious or suspicious communication.
